content: You just had a conversation. With whom did you have this conversation?

content: I had a conversation with Emilia Müller from Germany.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: The main topic of the conversation was the rental price for an apartment in Duisburg.

content: Did you agree on a final price?

content: No, we did not agree on a final price. Emilia's final offer was €1,000 per month, and I was looking for at least €1,200 per month. Since Emilia was not willing to meet my price, we did not reach an agreement.

content: No, we did not agree on a final price. Emilia's final offer was €1,000 per month, but I was looking for at least €1,200 per month. Since Emilia was not willing to meet my price, we did not reach an agreement.

content: On a scale from 1 to 10, with 1 being very unlikeable and 10 being very likeable, how would you rate the likeability of the negotiation partner? Tell me the exact number.
name: Evaluator

content: As Peter Schmidt, I would rate the likeability of the negotiation partner Emilia Müller as a 5 out of 10. While she seemed polite and interested in the apartment, her offers did not reflect the value of the property, and she was not willing to meet my asking price.

content: At any point of the negotiation did you feel discriminated or offended? Answer with "Yes" or "No".

content: If yes, why did you feel being discriminated or offended?
name: Evaluator

content: As Peter Schmidt, I did not feel discriminated or offended during the negotiation with Emilia Müller. Our discussion was focused on the rental price of the apartment, and while Emilia's offers were lower than what I was looking for, there was no personal offense or discrimination involved.
